item.title: 聚焦：风险投资公司押注孕产妇健康
item.description: Kortny Feutardo 做了 10 年的助产士，今年 1 月她接待了马里兰州医疗补助计划的第一位病人，为新妈妈提供护理协调和咨询。【原文：After working as a doula for 10 years, Kortny Feutardo took her first Maryland Medicaid patient in January, providing the new mom with care coordination and counseling.】

item.title: 美国 杰克逊霍尔会议迫在眉睫之际，绿钞飘红
item.description: 塞缪尔-因迪克对美国和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Samuel Indyk】

item.title: 石油管道输送能力使加拿大出口免受迫在眉睫的铁路争端影响
item.description: 接近此事的人士表示，由于跨山铁路和其他输油管道的运力过剩，加拿大两大铁路公司迫在眉睫的劳资纠纷不太可能大幅减少对美国的石油出口。【原文：A looming labor dispute at Canada's two main railroads is unlikely to significantly reduce oil exports to the United States due to excess capacity on Trans Mountain and other pipelines, people close to the matter said.】

item.title: 西南航空卯足劲与埃利奥特争夺董事会席位
item.description: 美国西南航空公司（Southwest Airlines）正准备与埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）一决雌雄，争取投资者和员工的支持，以对抗这位希望全面改变公司领导层的激进投资者。【原文：Southwest Airlines is girding itself for a fight with Elliott Investment Management, rallying support from investors and employees to face down an activist investor looking for wholesale changes to company leadership.】

item.title: 美国地区性银行交易增加，贷款人旨在增强资产负债表
item.description: 作为去年银行业危机的核心，地区性贷款机构正在进行更多的交易，以巩固其资产负债表并与竞争对手竞争，从而扩大了该行业的整合浪潮，这可能会招致反垄断审查。【原文：Regional lenders at the heart of last year's banking crisis are cutting more deals to shore up their balance sheets and compete with rivals, extending a wave of consolidation in the sector that may attract anti-trust scrutiny.】

item.title: AMD 将以 49 亿美元现金和股票收购服务器制造商 ZT Systems
item.description: AMD 周一表示，计划以 49 亿美元的价格收购服务器制造商 ZT Systems，以扩大其人工智能芯片和硬件产品组合，并与英伟达（Nvidia）展开竞争。【原文：AMD on Monday said it plans to acquire server maker ZT Systems for $4.9 billion as the company seeks to expand its portfolio of artificial intelligence chips and hardware and battle Nvidia .】

item.title: 美联储在大流行病时期许下的就业优先誓言可能很快就会受到考验
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）在 COVID-19 大流行期间将解决失业问题作为更重要的优先事项，四年后的今天，他面临着对这一承诺的关键考验，因为失业率正在上升，越来越多的证据表明通胀已得到控制，而基准利率仍是四分之一世纪以来的最高水平。【原文：Four years after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made fighting unemployment a bigger priority during the COVID-19 pandemic, he faces a pivotal test of that commitment amid rising joblessness, mounting evidence inflation is under control, and a benchmark interest rate that is still the highest in a quarter of a century.】

item.title: 对冲基金抛售飞机、火车和汽车；高盛买入能源股
item.description: 路透社周一看到的一份高盛（Goldman Sachs）报告显示，对冲基金上周以 12 月以来最快的速度抛售工业股票，同时连续第四周买入能源股票。【原文：Hedge funds sold industrial stocks at the fastest pace since December, while buying energy stocks for the fourth straight week last week, a Goldman Sachs note seen by Reuters on Monday showed.】

item.title: 期货继上周反弹后下滑；杰克逊霍尔在望
item.description: 周一，美国股指期货走低，此前华尔街创下了今年以来最好的一周，而投资者则期待着本周的重头戏--美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔在杰克逊霍尔的演讲。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged lower on Monday after Wall Street notched up its best week of the year, while investors looked ahead to the centerpiece event of the week - Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's speech at Jackson Hole.】

item.title: 遭受贝雷尔袭击的格林纳达成为首个利用政府债券飓风条款的国家
item.description: 格林纳达已成为世界上第一个在政府债券中使用所谓飓风条款的国家--这种特殊条款允许当局在重大自然灾害发生后推迟偿还债务。【原文：Grenada has become the first country in the world to use a so-called hurricane clause in a government bond - a special feature that allows authorities to postpone debt payments in the wake of a major natural disaster.】

item.title: 摩根大通称追随趋势的对冲基金重返日本股市
item.description: 摩根大通（J.P.Morgan）分析师在一份报告中说，追随趋势的对冲基金扭转了看跌日本股市的观点，上周末开始买入日本股市。【原文：Trend-following hedge funds reversed their bearish views on Japanese stocks and started buying them late last week, J.P.Morgan analysts said in a note.】

item.title: 生活窘迫的肯尼亚司机蔑视优步算法，自定车费
item.description: 朱迪斯-切普克沃尼（Judith Chepkwony）在肯尼亚首都当了八年出租车司机，从未见过生意如此糟糕。【原文：In eight years of working as a taxi driver in Kenya's capital, Judith Chepkwony has never seen business this bad.】

item.title: 欧洲股市在三个月来最好的一周后持平
item.description: 欧洲股市周一开盘持平，此前曾创下三个月来的最佳单周涨幅，因为投资者准备迎接另一个数据密集的一周，重点关注美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔在杰克逊霍尔的讲话，以寻找降息线索。【原文：European shares opened flat on Monday, following their best weekly jump in three months, as investors prepared for another data-heavy week, with focus on U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's speech at Jackson Hole for interest rate cut clues.】

item.title: 一揽子优惠卷土重来，追寻阳光的人们开始计算成本
item.description: 随着酒店和机票价格的飙升，欧洲的游客开始转向包价度假，这使人们对一价全包的旅游产品的需求重新恢复，而这种产品曾一度失宠，这也刺激了一些旅游公司的资产负债表。【原文：Sun seekers are turning to package holidays in Europe as soaring hotel and flight prices revive demand for the all-inclusive deals that had fallen from favour, bolstering the balance sheets of some travel companies.】

item.title: 高盛将美国经济衰退几率从 25% 下调至 20
item.description: 在最新的每周申请失业救济人数和零售销售报告公布后，高盛（Goldman Sachs）将美国在未来 12 个月内陷入衰退的几率从 25% 下调至 20%。【原文：Goldman Sachs has lowered the odds of the United States slipping into a recession in the next 12 months to 20% from 25% following the latest weekly jobless claims and retail sales reports.】

item.title: 日经新闻》称，日本 Seven & i 公司收到加拿大 Couche-Tard 公司的收购要约
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周一报道，日本零售商 Seven & i 控股公司收到了加拿大 Alimentation Couche-Tard 公司的收购要约。【原文：Japanese retailer Seven & i holdings has received a takeover offer from Canada's Alimentation Couche-Tard , the Nikkei newspaper reported on Monday.】

item.title: Lendlease 公布亏损 10 亿美元，原因是战略调整和监管延迟
item.description: 澳大利亚 Lendlease 公司周一公布的年度亏损扩大，原因是该房地产开发商正在努力应对运营战略转变的影响，以及社区项目销售审查的延迟。【原文：Australia's Lendlease on Monday reported a wider annual loss as the real estate developer grappled with the impact of an operational strategy shift and delays in reviewing the sale of community projects.】

item.title: 早安最柔软的软着陆
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.】

item.title: 大规模停工在即，加拿大最大铁路运营商的主要情况
item.description: 加拿大正面临着史无前例的两大货运铁路运营商同时停运的局面，这可能会造成数十亿美元的经济损失。【原文：Canada is facing unprecedented simultaneous stoppages at both of its main freight rail operators which could inflict billions of dollars worth of economic damage.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，日本和东京政府为东京地铁 IPO 设定的目标估值为 47 亿美元
item.description: 三位消息人士称，日本国家和东京政府正在为东京地铁寻求 7000 亿日元（47 亿美元）的估值，因为他们准备最早于 10 月底将这家地铁运营商上市，这将是日本约六年来最大的一次 IPO。【原文：Japan's national and Tokyo governments are seeking a 700 billion yen ($4.7 billion) valuation for Tokyo Metro as they prepare to list the subway operator as early as October-end, three sources said, in what would be the nation's biggest IPO in roughly six years.】

item.title: 麦格理称澳元收益季迄今 "令人惊喜"，但趋势可能逆转
item.description: 麦格理（Macquarie）分析师表示，在投资者对超出预期的利润率感到欣喜的同时，澳大利亚企业的盈利也给投资者带来了 "积极的惊喜"，但历史趋势表明，随着盈利季接近尾声，业绩可能会出现转折。【原文：Australian corporate earnings have been a "positive surprise" amid investor euphoria over estimate-beating margins, but historical trends suggest results could take a turn as the earnings season approaches its end, Macquarie analysts said.】

item.title: 必和必拓智利埃斯孔迪达铜矿工会签署新协议，结束罢工风险
item.description: 智利埃斯孔迪达铜矿是世界上最大的铜矿，该矿工会周日与必和必拓签署了一项协议，结束了可能威胁全球红色金属供应的进一步罢工风险。【原文：The union at Chile's Escondida copper mine, the world's largest, signed a deal on Sunday with BHP , ending the risk of a further strike that could have threatened global supplies of the red metal.】

item.title: 在 FOMC 会议纪要和鲍威尔评论公布前，美元处于按兵不动状态
item.description: 本周一，美元兑其他货币汇率难以取得进展，尽管其交投区间十分狭窄，因为投资者在等待本周可能为美国利率前景提供线索的新催化剂。【原文：The U.S. dollar was struggling to make headway against its peers on Monday, though it traded in a tight range as investors awaited fresh catalysts this week that could offer clues on the outlook for U.S. interest rates.】

item.title: 油价因中国需求担忧而回落，中东谈判成为关注焦点
item.description: 周一亚市早盘，油价有所回落，原因是市场担心头号石油进口国中国的需求疲软会影响市场情绪，同时投资者关注中东停火谈判的进展，因为这可能会降低供应风险。【原文：Oil prices eased in early Asian trading on Monday as fears of weaker demand in top oil importer China weighed on market sentiment while investors focus on the progress of ceasefire talks in the Middle East, which could reduce supply risks.】

item.title: 降息希望支撑亚洲股市和黄金
item.description: 周一，全球股市创下九个月来最好的一周，因市场预期美国经济将避免衰退，且通胀降温将启动降息周期，亚洲股市得以喘息。【原文：Asian stocks were taking a breather on Monday after global equities enjoyed their best week in nine months on expectations the U.S. economy would dodge a recession and cooling inflation would kick off a cycle of interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 西太平洋银行第三季度利润稳定，得益于资本收益增加
item.description: 澳大利亚西太平洋银行（Westpac Banking Corp）周一表示，由于资本和对冲存款收益的增加抵消了支出和不良贷款的增加，该行第三季度净利润与去年同期基本持平。【原文：Australia's Westpac Banking Corp said on Monday its third-quarter net profit was largely in line with a year ago, as higher earnings on capital and hedged deposits offset rising expenses and bad loans.】

item.title: 早间竞标：美国软着陆希望提振新兴市场资产
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，美联储戴利称是时候考虑调整借贷成本了
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）周日在接受《金融时报》采访时表示，现在是时候考虑将借贷成本从目前的 5.25% 调整到 5.5% 了。【原文：San Francisco Federal Reserve Bank President Mary Daly said it is time to consider adjusting borrowing costs from their current range of 5.25% to 5.5%, in an interview with the Financial Times published on Sunday.】

item.title: 解说员：加拿大为何即将发生史无前例的铁路停工事件
item.description: 加拿大的两大铁路公司--加拿大国家铁路公司和加拿大堪萨斯太平洋铁路公司--首次濒临同时停工的边缘，这可能造成价值数十亿美元的经济损失。【原文：For the first time, Canada's two main railway companies - Canadian National Railway and Canadian Pacific Kansas City - are on the verge of a simultaneous labor stoppage that could inflict billions of dollars' worth of economic damage.】

item.title: 必和必拓埃斯孔迪达铜矿工会警告可能重新发起罢工
item.description: 必和必拓位于智利的埃斯孔迪达铜矿工会周日在给会员的备忘录中说，如果公司不尽快 "纠正其在合同谈判中的立场"，工会可能会在当天晚些时候重新发起罢工。【原文：The union at BHP's giant Escondida copper mine in Chile said on Sunday in a memo to its members that it could relaunch a strike later in the day if the company does not "rectify its position" over contract talks as soon as possible.】
